title: Hustlers
description: A crew of savvy former strip club employees band together to turn the tables on their Wall Street clients.

reviews.text: Fresh off its illustrious festival debut at TIFF, writer/director Lorene Scafaria's "Hustlers" represents a solidly crafted and evocatively vibrant portrait of a true-to-life world of depravity, desperation, and crime, but not a whole lot else. As a morality play, the film wavers between ambivalently observing and downright smirking at the questionable actions of the characters at large, an approach that doesn't exactly line up symmetrically with the more stern and cautionary final act. How are we supposed to feel about these characters? I at least felt certain of this at the end of the film, but throughout? Not sure. The performances are all quite good, with Constance Wu and Jennifer Lopez among the standouts. I honestly wish I had more to say with this one, but I really don't think I was given that much else to discuss.
The movie was ok. Nothing special. I could have waited to watch at home. Movie was just ok.
OMG JLO SNAPPED, this is one of the best movies i’ve ever seen, if you didn’t watch it yet, GO

Good film.'Hustlers' makes for satisfactory viewing. Jennifer Lopez (Ramona) is accomplished in one of the two lead roles, I've previously enjoyed her in 2013's 'Parker'; which is the better film, but individually she's best here for sure. Credit also to Constance Wu (Destiny).Solidly told story, a few decent song choices in there too. All in all, it's a pleasant film to watch. Recommended.

This is a lot like “Widows” for me. Great cast led by a totally game leading lady, with what should be an intriguing crime-centered plot. But it plays out more like an arthouse flick than enjoyable popcorn film, and despite appreciating it I wasn’t finding myself entirely entertained.
Strippers rolling drunks (or drugsed). More male appeal than when alley rats do it. No Lopez, no movie.
Great movie, great actors.  Jlo gives her best here.  Enjoyed with friends.  Good to see woman supporting each other, rather than being jealous of each other

A mix of comedy, true crime, and social commentary, Hustlers is a visually engaging, well-written, and overall enjoyable cinematic experience. Jennifer Lopez delivers a bravura performance truly worthy of a Best Supporting Actress nomination at the Oscars. Her Ramona is charismatic, nuanced, scheming, funny, suave, and motherly all at once; though largely an ensemble piece, Lopez’s performance truly ties the entire film together — from her dazzling entrance to her final line.
I enjoyed the movie. Pleasantly surprised at its candid view of their lives. Also felt like they didn’t draw conclusions on the ethical sides, but presented the story instead.

What they think that made it look not sexy, actually did, they needed a better guidance, that's all.HustlersLorene Scafaria, the writer and director, is a hustler. Similar to the film, we, the clients, are robbed shamingly. But what's interesting is that the film loses at the end of the day. Not even looking at the intentions of the film, the film, as a story, had an extremely solid argument to walk through that Oscars table head held high. And instead the opportunity is not only missed but chucked away for cheap thrills and manipulative emotional blackmail. And this could have been a worthy Oscars contender and is instead just an Oscars contender.And I emphasize on how big a mistake they made, on going light on this material. What the film industry, in the last few years, had twisted and turned its way out to address the political correctness, is something that the film has in its pocket all along. So now, all they had to do was carve a compelling drama. And instead they are overcooking those same ingredients, that turns into a preaching to the choir tone, within the first act.The film craves for such moments. If anything it goes all the way around, just to create memorable scenarios, to the price of pacing. And it is not the pace I have an issue with, it is the two page script that is told magnanimously within two hours that I can't just "whoooooo" around. The film is also hard to watch. Not for the justification it attempts to give its characters but also the justification that it doesn't give to its characters. And it is not the narrative but the visualization of that crime scene that makes it horrible. For if told properly and rummaged around the files, dug deep into their homework, you will find a sweet spot to explore that would balance these Hustlers.

Sooooooooo bad. Wannabe Molly’s Game mixed with some mafia up and coming make money make moves spend money on more and more material stuff. Wow. So predictable. So repetitive. Screenplay is rail thin. Can get this whole story in one article. Nothing to really uncover and discover. Directing is so so. Jennifer Lopez did look insanely hot for her age and pulled off the role. Only because me too movement and female empowerment did this movie get the reviews it did. Nobody wants to look at the quality just stay in the safe zone. Sad but true .

Wow. This movie is so bad that even walking out on it was somehow unsatisfying. It left me wanting to do something more -- like warning people, even those I don't particularly like, not to waste their money on it. Critics who had anything good to say about it should be barred from the profession, and moviegoers who liked it should not be allowed to bring children into the world. One critic called this Jennifer Lopez' best performance in years. That's like saying Showgirls was Elizabeth Berkley at her best. How bad does a film have to be before you walk out on it even though there are a lot of hot, busty women in short skirts? See this film and you'll find out. It is beneath contempt.

This is wrong people praising things like this as female empowerment. The show is meh, the acting horrible and writing sucks real bad and unrelatable characters(although it is the point). A 2 for me at best

Just more rampant misandry, that's why you're seeing such positive reviews from Hollywood critics. If you liked the Ghostbusters reboot, you'll love this movie! "Women scamming men good and funny, men scamming women bad and offensive" is the central theme here. It's something of an autobiography for Cardi B and other thots.

(Mauro Lanari)Ugly, cretinous, horrendous: it upsets that the super-rich Wall Street brokers can lose their heads behind strippers, lap and pole dancers even deficient of the minimum charm of a high-profile call girl. The comparisons with both the "Magic Mike" diptych and the themed films by Stone, Scorsese and McKay are superfluous. Whoever undergoes the spell of a J. Lo should decide if he has more urgency than an andrological or psychiatric visit.
The weight was missing. The scenes that had opportunity to be heavy hitting were too short, and the repetitive montages were too long.
Just a long J Lo ego trip, and very predictable story line. We left before it finished as we had had some paint to watch dry at home.
Boring, Jlo is just playing herself. Confused as to why this has so much critical acclaim.

It's very interesting, mainly because it is based on true facts. The entire film is sustained on a more comical basis, bringing some emotional parts - such as the family issue and the mother-daughter bond. However, some performances was not that good, even though they have some big names.

In a lot of ways, Hustlers is a really fresh film. The plot is innovative and engaging. The acting performances are stellar, particularly Jennifer Lopez, who delivers one of her best performances in years. However, something about the pacing and story just feels empty. The second act in particular just feels cliche and lackluster in spite of the premise. It's still a good watch, but I feel some scenes just dragged on and on.

Ignore the incels/misogynists here and other sites leaving transparently bad scores and reviews. This movie is entertaining and Lopez and Wu put in strong performances. My main criticism is it does drag some in the second act and, while the story is told from Wu's perspective, they should've done a better job developing Lopez's backstory.

Entertaining!  That's all I really ask of any film.  This one's also interesting because it's a true story.  Acting is okay, nothing stellar.  Constance Wu has too many tiny-tears scenes where she's staring into space and you can almost see the eyedropper dripping the water on her face.  Quite a few good laughs though.They should have left out the frequently-vomiting girl.  Added nothing whatsoever.  When will screenwriters realize that puking is NOT FUNNY?  Grow up, screenwriters.
Disappointing.  There's magic in the first 20 minutes or so, but the film really goes nowhere, and there's very little on the line.

Sure, there are some fun moments in this film, and J-Lo is great, but there is absolutely NO substance to this film. There's no real crisis, there's not much at stake, and Constance Wu is utterly ill-equipped to carry the film as the lead.  I loved her in Crazy Rich Asians, but she doesn't do much for his hollowed-out story.  I hadn't realized that this was based on a newspaper article, but it makes perfect sense.  It's light-weight. About a third of my theater left before it was over.

Just liked the conned people in the movie, I too was conned by the glowing reviews. The first 20min were fun, then the movie became unwatchable. Avoid at all costs, terrible screenplay, and you have NO ONE to root for in this mess.
Absolutely disgusting and appaling. Not surprising though that hollywood would glorify such horrendous behavior.
Yikes. Terrible film. Feminist hogwash. Terrible cast. Terrible acting. What the hell was this ?

This film is based on a true story about a group of exotic dancers who concocted a scheme to bilk rich Wall Street clients. Constance Wu plays the new girl who's taken under the tutelage of the accomplished mastermind (Jennifer Lopez, introduced via an amazing dance number and looking fantastic throughout). At first, things are all fun and director Lorene Scafaria has captured the carefree repartee and lively lifestyle with a natural energy. Although there's too much time spent on the party aspects, once matters gets serious, the drama develops adequately. Anyone expecting hot chicks on the pole will enjoy the first 30 minutes, but there's more to be appreciated in watching the relationships that develop and the machinations of their crime.

Beautiful work from writer-director Lorene Scafaria. A valentine to female friendship and a condemnation of an engendered capitalist system. Wu and Lopez are phenomenal in fully rendered, dimensional parts. There are no heroes in this film - as well there shouldn't be. But Wu and Lopez craft their characters with tremendous humanity, equal parts empathy and frailty. Scafaria rightly depicts the victim's perspective of the events that unfolded too but doesn't condemn her characters for it - as there is a larger, more antagonistic, more pervasive economic system to which they ALL fall victim.
very good casting  and performing; music was good, political references were great.

This movie can't hold a candle to the Magic Mike's movies , it's absolute trash , no story , no climax , just pole dancers and bad writting. This happens when you hire all female staff and try to milk the sex workers real life stories. AVOID

I found a valid movie. And obviously shock the conservatives. These are the ones who still create profile here to rate the movie poorly. The movie is fun and sexy and the script flows lightly to the imminent outcome. Jennifer did her best and proved her worth as an actress

'Hustlers' is not as groundbreaking as festival critics set it out to be, but enjoyable nonetheless. Constance Wu may be the lead actress in #Hustlers, but it's Jennifer Lopez who shines through (especially at 50 years of age).The key issue about 'Hustlers' that's still being discussed is whether or not the movie condones the "Robin Hood-esque" actions/crimes perpetrated by this opportunistic group of ladies. I personally wasn't bothered by it. The film ultimately felt ambivalent to their crimes. (But I know there are critics who think the film doesn't do enough to rebuke their actions — considering events in this movie happened in real life.)Caution: To those of us who grew up listening to the magnificent pop music of the 2007s, you will want to dance and sob and remember that amazing, care-free era of our lives. #NeverForget: “Gimme More”, “Love In This Club”, “Club Can't Handle Me”, “Beautiful Girls”, “Motivation” + more.
Best Movie of 2019A masterpiece, JLegend has the best female movie performance of 2019She deserves to win an Oscar!
Una hermosa película la actuación de Jlo es digna de los premios mas importante de la industria

My review of #Hustlers:Thanks to a performance from a cool cast with JLo, Constance Wu, Keke Palmer and Lili Reinhart, this movie teaches us us that even strippers can’t be trusted and that no one, on both sides (rich or poor), stay good forever.My final rating: 4.5/5. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️.5 out of 5 stars.Also, Cardi B and Lizzo are only in the movie for 2 minutes of the first act.

Hustlers was so good! It’s a must watch. Jennifer Lopez and Constance Wu are amazing in this!! Cardi made me laugh so hard, her presence is so strong...like I need to see more of her in movies.  I definitely want to see Hustlers again.
It was more of a Netflix movie! Yes, JLO did her thing dancing on that pole, but I was disappointed paying $14 to see it.

I struggle to see why critics haven given this movie such shining reviews but, that doesn't mean I hated this movie. The performances for the most part were very compelling and the first act was quite engaging. The problems come from the repetitive nature of the second act which unfortunately took away from my overall enjoyment of the film.
An entertaining movie with sn amazing soundtrack, definitely worth a watch.
Awful. Boring. Avoid. Awful. Boring. Avoid. Awful. Boring. Avoid. Awful. Boring. Avoid.
Much better than I anticipated. Great to see a new female director getting a movie right. J-lo is great here, her best role since Out of Sight!

JLo es excelente actriz, se merece ser nominada al Oscar, Golden Globe, SAG y BAFTA. Y no soy el único que lo dice, ella tendría que tener esos premios hace años, por Selena, Out Of Sight, The Cell y Enough.
Ужасный фильм, не советую никому. Ожидания конечно не оправдались, не тратье время

Many years ago, when I was a kid, I use to dream of Chita Rivera and Rita Moreno doing a cabaret show together but now that I am a big kid I think of a cabaret show starring Jennifer Lopez and Beyonce Knowles. Where does all this come from? Watching "Hustlers" I thought of Lopez making a big splash in the movies when she starred opposite George Clooney in "Out of  Sight" and Beyonce doing the same when she co-starred in the movie "Dreamgirls" and neither did any more movies worthwhile.Chita became a star playing Anita in "West Side Story" on Broadway and Rita won an Oscar for the same role in the movies. Chita would remain a big and much loved star on Broadway for the next 60 years while Rita became a star on television.In any case, thinking about the 4 women was a diversion from looking at a movie that, while certainly glorifying a woman's body, shows smart women 'taking' dumb rich men. It sort of looks like in spite of all having sad backgrounds, most being uneducated, what choice did women have except for pleasuring men whether stripping or giving them lap dancers while other men took most of the money they made.This all takes place before the 2008 recession when men threw money around as if it wasn't theirs and in most cases it wasn't but then that recession came along and the women team up together to fleece the wealthy clients they still have, making thousands of dollars knowing the men are either married or would be too humiliated to report them to the police or still had enough money not to worry about.After Lopez's fantastic entrance doing a pole dance I lost interest in the rest of the movie possibly because the story of rich men being taken is so common place in South Florida that it seems to be in the paper and on television at least once a month if not once a week.The performances, by Lopez especially, are all good while the direction by Lorene Scafaria keeps the movie going but her screenplay, based on a  2015 magazine story by Jessica Pressler, gets tiresome very quickly."Hustlers" is getting good reviews including talk about Lopez getting an Oscar nomination but I would rather see a 'duel' between her and Knowles or, even better, between Moreno and Rivera!

A very entertaining movie that has a fresh and interesting perspective into the world of hustlers. I was skeptical about watching it at first but decided to watch it since it was my mom's birthday and let's just say, I wasn't bored at all. It kept me guessing, laughing and empathyzing with the characters.

Jennifer Lopez deserves an Oscar for her supporting role, period. She completely transforms into Ramona and takes command of every scene she's in. The cast was amazing, the script, the acting, the comedy, the drama, the emotion, the cinematography, everything just flowed graciously. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who loves a classic crime/mafia film a la Goodfellas or Boogie Nights.

Spectacular acting, funny and sexy. Jennifer Lipez did a great comeback. The rest of the girls did great too. I wanted to see more of Cardi B. She would have made it even funnier. She is one of the reasons I went to see the movie.
HUSTLERS was so so **** good. I was in Toronto while I watched it and everybody **** clapped at the end. I was in awe.
Very good jlo did great and Card b was very funny great job to all the actresses.
